page.title: 02The Villages NE. of Tiverton
page.content: Chevithorne has a war memorial as you come into the village.Opposite is St.Thomas' church built in 1843.It also has a small Methodist Chapel and I expect people go there on Sunday mornings.There is also a village hall which used to be a school.There is a post box and a public telephone.There are a lot of fields and a few houses and farms.At East Mere there used to be a dairy.There are a few houses but most of East Mere is fields and countryside. There are no pubs in the villages so most people shop in Tiverton.There is a long lane with fields and hedges and a few houses at the side in East Mere. In Craze Loman the river Loman is crossed by a bridge with a water measure beside it because of floods. There is a cottage where they make soft toys. The gardens are very neat.
